title: Fallon injures (other) hand while celebrating
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Fallon injures (other) hand while celebrating Jimmy Fallon had an eventful Saturday: He paraded through Harvard square on a chariot, accepted a Harvard Lampoon award and was reportedly hospitalized. Post to Facebook Fallon injures (other) hand while celebrating Jimmy Fallon had an eventful Saturday: He paraded through Harvard square on a chariot, accepted a Harvard Lampoon award and was reportedly hospitalized.  //on.wtsp.com/1S4sKRT   Join the Conversation To   Fallon injures (other) hand while celebrating Associated Press, AP 1:57 p.m. EDT October 25, 2015 FILE - In this Aug. 25, 2014, file photo, Jimmy Fallon presents an award at the 66th Annual Primetime Emmy Awards in Los Angeles. Fallon got the royal treatment at Harvard. "The Tonight Show" host and "Saturday Night Live" alum was honored Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, by the Harvard Lampoon, the country's oldest continuously published humor magazine. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP, File) ORG XMIT: NY107 (Photo: Chris Pizzello, Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Jimmy Fallon had an eventful Saturday: He paraded through Harvard square on a chariot, accepted a Harvard Lampoon award and was reportedly hospitalized. 
People reports that Fallon fell while holding a bottle of Jagermeister, and later checked in to Massachusetts General Hospital, because of the injury. 
Fallon, who accepted the Harvard Lampoon Elmer Award for Excellence in Humor, was later seen in photos with a bandaged right hand. 
Aside from the injury, the event seemed to go well, with Fallon parading throughHarvard Square in a Roman chariot and festive headwear. The parade ended at the steps of Lampoon Castle, where Fallon was presented with an award and an 85-cent check. YOU MAY ALSO LIKE...
